column4: totem is using 50% or more of my CPU, but is not actively open. It is showing as "Uninterruptible" and will not respond to kill signals. Can someone please advise?
kill -9 will not kill the process. I have never had this happen before.
How can a process be Uninterruptible such that kill -9 doesn't work?
several ways.. NOHUP is one wat
although I'm not sure if using NOHUP makes it "uninterruptible" in htop and such
pike_: But this is totem... should it be running short of me opening it to play a video?
My CPU is at 100% at it is using half of that, is there a way to kill it? or see what is blocking me?
hmm.. if it's uninterruptable I don't really know how to kill it, sorry
you're welcome to try here.. but I've got a feeling you might get better answers somewhere else.. #linux perhaps?
unless you're trying to squeeze extra battery time out of a laptop.. or running something very special I doubt you'll gain much by compiling your own
Because apparently too many people hit it by accident.
painted: You could restart X with "sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart"
I suppose you could also go to run level 3 to kill X, lol. Not exactly a good way to do it though.
isn't runlevel 3 the standard runlevel in ubuntu?
